articles.author: Leafy Mate
articles.description: Last week, 63 percent of Oklahoma voters said no to a proposal that would have allowed recreational marijuana use for people over 21. This means that the recreational use of marijuana is still not legal in Oklahoma, even though the state has already approved over 2,800 medical marijuana licenses.
articles.title: The Battle for Marijuana Legalization in Oklahoma: Why Voters Ultimately Said ‘No’
